Jose Mourinho admits he is struggling to find a balance with his Manchester United side after they limped into the Europa League final against Celta Vigo.

United recorded their 12th 1-1 draw of the campaign to overcome Celta 2-1 on aggregate during a nervy night at Old Trafford which ended with John Guidetti spurning a glorious chance to send Celta to the Stockholm final.

Celta were the superior side for the majority of the semi-final second leg as United's pragmatic approach continued against the 12th-placed La Liga side.

Mourinho could be seen urging his players higher up the pitch and stressed he did not want United to withdraw so deep during the second-half but instinct forced them further back.

"You know, every game is a game with a different story," Mourinho said. "But our story this season was normally when we play very well we don't score enough goals, and then when you don't play so well you are in trouble, this is basically our story.

Manchester United player Paul Pogba growing into new role under Jose MourinhoPaul Pogba growing into new role under Jose Mourinho
"In Vigo, we played very well, from the first minute I felt on the bench calm, relaxed, everything was under control, I don't remember one chance that they have, I remember chances - big chances - to kill the game and the tie.

"Today in the second-half they had nothing to lose, mentally, they had that advantage, the team that has nothing to lose against the team that is winning, that plays at home with responsibility on their shoulders and then they gamble.

"It's difficult to get the players to bring the block up but they know they are winning, they know they are not far from reaching the final, so they stay back and I had to choose in that moment to bring, for example, Martial or Mata on to give some support because the block is staying back.

"And then Eric [Bailly] is out, and okay they lost a player but I lost a central defender, so I have to play Smalling in that moment in central defence

Manchester United have a deal in place to sign wantaway Real Madrid midfielder James Rodriguez in the summer, according to a report from RCN Radio.

The Colombia international reportedly has grown increasingly frustrated with his limited game time in the Spanish capital under Real boss Zinedine Zidane and is ready to force a move away in the summer.

James and agent Jorge Mendes are said to have held talks with Real president Florentino Perez this week, where the pair told the Blancos chief a deal is in place for the 25-year-old to make a switch to Old Trafford.
